body_content.explanation: A non-migratory bird or animal is one that does not migrate (= travel to a different place, usually when the season changes):
examples: Non-migratory monarch butterflies tend to live for only a few weeks.
This particular hawk is a non-migratory species that is found only in certain parts of the western United States.
Because they are nonmigratory, some birds and mammals must collect and store a cache of food in order to survive a long and harsh winter.
